panda_ui_controller.py
Go to the documentation of this file.
1 #!/usr/bin/env python
2 """
3 Panda UI Controller.
4 Uses 7 sliders to manipulate the position of the panda
5 """
6 
7 from kivy.app import App
8 from kivy.uix.slider import Slider
9 from kivy.uix.gridlayout import GridLayout
10 from kivy.uix.label import Label
11 import sys
12 import numpy as np
13 import rospkg
14 sys.path.append(rospkg.RosPack().get_path('ros_robotic_skin'))
15 from scripts.controllers.PandaController import PandaController # noqa: E402
16 
17 
18 class PandaPositionMover(GridLayout):
19  def __init__(self, **kwargs):
20  super(PandaPositionMover, self).__init__(**kwargs)
21  self.controller = PandaController()
22  # Start from default value in sliders
23  self.desired_positions = [0, 0, 0, -0.0698, 0, 0, 0]
24  # set panda to initial positions
25  self.controller.publish_positions(self.desired_positions, 0.1)
26  self.cols = 3
27  # The limits are from the website:
28  # https://frankaemika.github.io/docs/control_parameters.html
29  self.label_values = []
30  limits = np.array([[-2.8973, 2.8973],
31  [-1.7628, 1.7628],
32  [-2.8973, 2.8973],
33  [-3.0718, -0.0698],
34  [-2.8973, 2.8973],
35  [-0.0175, 3.7525],
36  [-2.8973, 2.8973]])
37  for idx in range(7):
38  joint_name = "Joint {}".format(idx+1)
39  starting_pos = self.desired_positions[idx]
40  slider = Slider(min=float(limits[idx, 0]), max=float(limits[idx, 1]), step=0.001, value=starting_pos, id=joint_name)
41  self.add_widget(Label(text="Panda {}".format(joint_name)))
42  self.add_widget(slider)
43  label = Label(text=str(starting_pos))
44  self.label_values.append(label)
45  self.add_widget(label)
46  slider.bind(value=self.slider_value_change)
47 
48  def slider_value_change(self, instance, joint_value):
49  joint_idx = int(instance.id[-1]) - 1
50  self.label_values[joint_idx].text = str(joint_value)
51  self.desired_positions[joint_idx] = joint_value
52  self.controller.publish_positions(self.desired_positions, 0.1)
53 
54 
55 class PandaSlider(App):
56  def build(self):
57  widgetcontainer = PandaPositionMover()
58  return widgetcontainer
59 
60 
61 if __name__ == "__main__":
62  PandaSlider().run()
